intro: Meliosma cornejoi, commonly known as the Mexican whitebeard tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in panicles, often blooming in the spring. Its fruit is a smooth, green berry that turns yellow when mature. Meliosma cornejoi is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
